title: Bypass fix in https://hackerone.com/reports/151516 report.

profile.name: Ian Dunn
profile.about: I'm a WordPress developer who maintains several small open source projects.

vulnerability_information:
Hi.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. The same in previous https://hackerone.com/reports/151516 report.
2. But payload to bypass your fix would be like this: `;=cmd|' /C calc'!A0`

**Solution:**

1. Add `;` in your escape function esc_csv() on line 2858 of camptix.php

**References:**

1. https://www.owasp.org/index.php/CSV_Excel_Macro_Injection

Tested on Windows 7 64 + Microsoft Office Exel 2003(think will work and on later versions)

Regards.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. The same in previous https://hackerone.com/reports/151516 report.
  2. But payload to bypass your fix would be like this: ;=cmd|' /C calc'!A0

Solution:

  1. Add ; in your escape function esc_csv() on line 2858 of camptix.php

References:

  1. https://www.owasp.org/index.php/CSV_Excel_Macro_Injection

Tested on Windows 7 64 + Microsoft Office Exel 2003(think will work and on later versions)

Regards.

Thanks lalka, this looks like a valid report. I'll dig into it and let you know once I reproduce it.

activities.message:
No porblem.

Also here is collection of most popular/exploitable payloads about csv injection:

%0A-2+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2 (bypass with new line)
=cmd|' /C calc'!A0
@SUM(cmd|'/c calc'!A0)
;=cmd|' /C calc'!A0
=HYPERLINK("https://evil.com")

Hope it will be useful for you and for writing secure code in the future :)

activities.message:
Hi, I couldn't get this working in Excel 2016 or LibreOffice 4.4.1.2.

I haven't tested older versions, but if it only works in 2003 then I'd consider this a very low severity. Excel 2003 was release 13 years ago, and there've been 4 major releases since then.

Do you have access to a more recent copy like 2013, or even 2010? Or have you seen any info online about `;` being a trigger character for CEMI? I wasn't able to find anything.

activities.message: I get copy of Excel 2016 and install on my VDS :) Yep, i can confirm - this payload NOT work in Excel 2016. Only in 2003-2013 versions.

activities.message:
Testing against Excel 2016 only confirms that it doesn't works in 2016; it doesn't mean that it works in 2013. Excel may have stopped supporting `;` in 2007 or 2010.

I'll need to test it, but it might take me a couple days before I have time.

activities.message:
I think we have different versions and different default settings/features of our installed copys of Excel. Maybe some differents on system enviroment. 

Also, yep, i think i found condition to exploit this payload. Pic attached. This feature on my pic run by default after installation when i try to open file. If i click "Enable" - payload will work on 2013 and 2016 Excel(was tested right now). If click "Disable" - payload will not work. 

But i dont know condition for this feature on my pic :) Hope i explain my idea with simple words. English is not my native language :)

activities.message:
No worries, you're a much better polyglot than I am :)

What locale is Windows / Excel set to use by default? Maybe that has something to do with it?

Regardless, I think the attached code will fix it. Would you mind testing it?

activities.message:
I decided on $100 as the award for this report. The reason it's lower than the award for #151516 is because it doesn't work in the latest version of Excel (unless the user manually imports the file and chooses `;` as the delimiter), and there also appear to be additional unknown conditions required to make it work in older versions.

I'm happy to add a bonus if you're able to find other bypasses, though.

activities.message:
Hi.

Yep, i think about it too. By default i have ru-RU locale, but i re-install  Excel to en-EN and payload still work.

Also, i found another report from H1 with this payload. Maybe this report help you. 

https://hackerone.com/reports/124223

OP said:

>; in the beggining acts as a new cell separator

About your fix - give me few hours and i will test :)

activities.message:
FYI, I just updated my program scope to specify that some edge cases will be closed as `Informative` rather than fixed.

Since you reported this before I made that decisions, I'm still going to close this as `Resolved`, but a bypass that only works in Excel, or only works in old versions of spreadsheet apps, etc, might not be accepted.

activities.message:
Great, thanks!

That'll be included in the next release of CampTix, but I don't know the exact date for that yet. I'd like to do it in the next week or two, but I'm still working on the newline issue in #160500, so it'll depend on how long that takes. 

You'll get credit in the changelog for discovering the issue. Once the release ships, I'll mark this as `Resolved` and request full disclosure.
